text: The 1979 British Open Championships was held at the Wembley Squash Centre in London from 31 March - 8 April 1979. Geoff Hunt won his sixth title defeating Qamar Zaman in a repeat of the 1978 final. ==Seeds== ==Draw and results== ===First Round*=== {| class="wikitable" |- !width=270| Player One !width=270|Player Two !width=150|Score |- | Geoff Hunt || Rehmatullah Khan ||9-1 9-3 5-9 9-1 |- | Kevin Shawcross || Bosse Boström ||9-2 9-6 9-5 |- | Ali Abdel Aziz || Ricki Hill ||9-6 9-1 9-5 |- | Glen Brumby || Torsam Khan ||w/o |- | Bruce Brownlee || Sajjad Muneer ||w/o |- | Steven Bowditch || Gavin Dupre ||9-6 6-9 9-3 10-8 |- | Robin Espie || John Catchpole ||9-7 9-4 10-8 |- | Dean Williams || Paul Chaplin ||9-2 9-2 9-3 |- | Roy Ollier || Len Steward ||9-6 8-10 9-3 9-2 |} ===Second Round*=== {| class="wikitable" |- !width=270| Player One !width=270|Player Two !width=150|Score |- | Geoff Hunt || Mohammed Asran || |- | Gogi Alauddin || Sharif Khan ||9-4 9-1 9-6 |- | Kevin Shawcross || Ian Robinson ||2-9 6-9 9-4 9-7 10-9 |- | Bruce Brownlee || Kim Bruce-Lockhart ||10-9 9-6 9-10 9-2 |} First Round* and Second Round* matches incomplete. ===Third Round to Final=== ==References== Category:Men's British Open Squash Championships Men's British Open Squash Championships Men's British Open Squash Championships Men's British Open Squash Championships Men's British Open Squash Championship Men's British Open Squash Championship Category:Squash competitions in London
title: 1979 Men's British Open Squash Championship
